Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mandasteve
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very clean . Breakfast was hearty . A tad expensive . But took 14 lads , so ideal for group bookings . Best room 36 !

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied for price”
Reviews.Author: christopher h Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy room,staff helpful apart from the room key cards not working every once in a while ,breakfast consists of toast ham and cheese plus boiled egg so don't expect a hearty breakfast but it was satisfying for breakfast,locatated in a quiet area about ten mins walk away from dam square ,if you like an early night for sleep beware the nightclub next door gets loud , overall satisfaction for the money I paid for two days stay

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brad N
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the Agora while visiting Amsterdam and I would say it was about what I expected.Contrary to some of the reviews on here, my wife and I did not have any problem with bed bugs, so that's a big plus. The positives: -GREAT location: not only was it a short trip from the train station, (approx. 10 euro taxi fare), but the beautiful flower market was right across the street. It was an easy (and beautiful) walk along canals to the Anne Frank house, the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Dam and Red Light District. - Staff: Not there overnight but any time we had questions about where to go or good places to eat, they would have a suggestion or directions right away. Even booked a taxi to the station the day before that was ready and waiting when we came down. The negatives: - Furniture/fixtures: Our actual hotel room seemed worn. The guide we had said that the rooms featured furniture from the 30's and 40's and that is true. Unfortunately, it doesn't look like the furniture has received as much as a coat of varnish since then. - The noise: As every review states, the night club next door can be very loud. We were several rooms over from the room that shares a wall with the club but we could hear the thumping beats and people talking outside (even heard someone throwing up, could have been our neighbor in the next room though). Overall, I do get the feeling that ownership is attempting to improve the hotel. The bathrooms have been recently remodeled and were the best part of the room. The staff there is genuinely friendly and helpful, and the location just can't be more centrally located. Staying there isn't cheap, but it didn't strike me as outrageously expensive by European standards. Not bad if you are looking for (relatively) cheap lodging in a great location for walking.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. To avoid.”
Reviews.Author: Vladimiir
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend in hotel Agora. We arrived in Friday, when we also bought 1 bottle of water and cola in the Albert hein in the corner. Went out in Saturday morning and coming back late in the afternoon. I drank my sparkling water, the taste was terrible, we found shampoo in the bottle ...then we found shampoo also in our bag that we left in the hotel. Also, we discovered that after having closed the door with the badge, the door still can be easily opened from outside!!!the stuff wasn't on the top with the explanaiton. It is obvious, that somebody entered in the room, and put shampoo everywhere.. Other surprise Sunday morning when I drank my coca cola, and the taste was terrifying with some alcohol in it. I talked to the stuff, asking explanation, wanted to call and talk to the owner, the stuff told me that he is in hospital. Actually I'm heading to the local police station to make a police record. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this filthy dump at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: M W
Reviews.Content: Hostile, unhelpful and aggressive staff. Situated next to a night club that makes the walls shake until 4-5am. Filthy rooms. Filthy bathoom. Not even bothered to change filthy sheets from the previous occupant. Eaten alive by bugs and charged 400 euros for one Saturday Night despite the rooms being capped at 125 euros. Avoid at all costs and get dumps like this closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: mhglasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights when at a conference in Amsterdam at recommendation of colleagues in Amsterdam, since I do not know the city well. Hotel was relatively expensive compared to quality it offered (Eur130 per night for single room). Beds were fine though I did wake up covered in bites and then read Trip Advisor reviews about bed bugs (a bit late!) Also bed cover was old and looked like it needed a good clean (sticky to touch). Breakfast was minimal and one family I met got nothing at all on their second day. Staff were fine. Location is excellent, especially for University, but I would shop around before settling for this.

Reviews.Title: “FITHY HOTEL not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: chmanagement10
Reviews.Content: Yes, it might be central, but it is filthy and the people who own the hotel don't care. since we last stayed there, they seem to have upgraded the breakfast room a bit. Do not ask for a canal view room, nor one facing the back they are all noisy ,tiny rooms and bathrooms not clean.I asked for extra Towel, which never came. the excuse was that they had some in the washing machine or dryer, and will let me have it later. Later never came?\ In all there are plenty other budget hotels in Amsterdam. Look on the internet and research.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leannewaterson11
Reviews.Content: I wasnt to sure about booking this hotel as i had read all the bad reviews but it was actually ok. It was in walking distance to everything we wanted to do eg Anne frank musem, dam square ect. Staff were very helpfull and pleasent. The only gripe i had was the beds wernt that comfortable and there must have been a party close but as i could here the music all night. I did the job if your looking for a budget hotel and not going to spend alot of time there except to get changed and a place to lay your head. Id definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tired-looking and shabby”
Reviews.Author: FrankWirral
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Agora before, several years ago and had a really good experience. This time however it was very poor. The signs were there from the start (broken/ damaged exterior hotel sign, room fittings broken or not working). What has happened to the lovely breakfast? Buffet was small and poor - had to ask for more coffee as it was cold. No milk on show so we had to ask for this too. Best not to look at the carpet in the breakfast area or you probably wouldn't eat your breakfast. Oh dear!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, location, service, friendliness”
Reviews.Author: HelenOLiverpool
Reviews.Content: A pleasant room overlooking the canal at a really good price. Located equidistant between the railway station and the Rikjsmuseum/Van Gogh Museum, it's really handy for all you need to do and see in the city. A 20 minute stroll from the railway station. Staff are helpful, and the breakfast is continental and you help yourself, with a late finish which is great for sleepyheads.

Reviews.Title: “I hope I will never have to experience anything like that”
Reviews.Author: klarapoupee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights over a weekend. At the night of Saturday upon Sunday we went out and came back around 4:00 AM. We could not open the door. The keycard worked, but the door was stuck. There was nobody at the front desk to open the door even the reception should be open 24h. We had to wait one hour outside in the cold (-2 and wind) and could not reach someone from the reception. After one hour the night receptionist came back and he promised them to stay longer then the official check-out time. Also he promised them that he will tell everything to the morning receptionist and that the problem would be solved. The morning receptionist did not know anything about this matter and could not help us. We would the last night to be refund. Only the manager can decide about this. Unfortunately she was not reachable before 4.00 PM. After 5 days, we are still waiting for her reply. After many phone calls and research on the Internet I called another hotel (the name of the hotel was a part of her email address) and called her. She answered nicely and when I asked her about this situation she was almost laughing at me and telling that she didn't have time to take care of that. I also would like mention, that pictures of this hotel you can find on their website, or other booking sites, are far away from the true. The eating room was very dirty and a glass door to the terrace were broken. First snow freezing cold was coming in all day long. The hotel is also very noisy and you can hear your neighbors conversation. When anyone in the hotel takes a shower, even you are in bed, it sounds like you having a shower with them. Horrible experience, I hope I will never have to deal with such a bad service ever.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever spent money in this overpriced, dirty hotel. if you do they rip you off”
Reviews.Author: ikbennietblij
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overpriced, dirty, smelly and we had a fly crawling inside the breakfast bread. I had a confirmation for 90 Euros a night but I was overcharged me 40 Euros on my bill at check in. 10 min after check in I found out and went back to reception. I was told this is how they confirm but rates are changing in the weekend. I complained as i was not told this at any point. The receptionist told me she had to speak to her manager. Over the weekend I returned several times but I had to wait for the manager. At check out I was finally told that the money would be transferred back in my account. I never got the money back!!!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianetall1957
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were met by a very pleasant gentleman. First impression of rooms were ah well its somewhere to sleep. Went out for the evening on return to our rooms we took time to have a little look around. bedding was clean, no remote control for tv, curtains hanging off curtain rail, lampshade broken, carpets dirty, both bedrooms dirty. The whole hotel is falling to bits. On taking breakfast in the morning, there was no breakfast tea, and the breakfast was of a very poor standard. staff were very rude. On leaving the hotel the following day, my daughter and her friend were covered in bites which we believe were from bed bugs. Do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Be warned. Â£50.00 per night per person.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dirty and in poor condition”
Reviews.Author: Natalie2010_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the recommendation of two guide books but were bitterly disappointed. We are well travelled and have stayed in better youth hostels!!! We were promised a garden room but ended up with a room that was in the middle of the building with windows opening over an exterior air vent. Mould in the bathroom. We asked FOUR times in our four night stay (twice in writing) for the light in the bathroom to be fixed to no avail. Double room had two single beds with holes in the sheet on one of them. Internet access in the rooms - you must be joking ... there was not even sufficient light to read by!! The breakfast room was grubby with foul carpet, filth from yesterday's breakfast still around the tables, dirty dishes from earlier diners, leaking roof and broken glass in picture window. Full ashtrays in the courtyard outside had been left out overnight and had filled up with rainwater - the stench from this permeating the dining room. Breakfast, we were told, ended at 11.00am but by 09.50 supplies had run low and it was being cleared away. Breakfast was a poor attempt at a continental breakfast. Not even 2 cup's worth of luke warm water in a thermos flask to make a cup of tea! The fact that this hotel was centrally situated (next to a noisy nightclub so don't expect to get a good night's sleep - and we did not even have a canal facing room!) was a blessing because it meant we could spend as little time as possible in the room. The two ladies on night duty were helpful and friendly, the guys on duty in the morning could not care less. On two separate occassions, we were in the lobby while the receptionists were trying to sort out double bookings. If you have not booked a hotel yet, DON'T book this one. We are sorry not to have read the June and July 2010 reviews before booking - they are spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1345
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in The Agora last week and it was disgusting! We heard about the hotel in a well trusted travel book, so we were surprised at the accommodations. Lobby and dining room were appalling. Carpets and furniture were old and stained...look to never have been updated! Rooms were old and filthy, not sure there is maid service. Quality of sheets and bed were awful...we didn't experience bed bugs, but felt creepy crawlers. Not sure the club is still under ownership, as we never heard music or crowds. However we did the stampede of other guests passing our door at all times of the night. Note this place has no elevator and is not suitable for those with carry-on luggage or larger, as there are very narrow steps. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! RUN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and bed bugs - wish I had read the June posting first”
Reviews.Author: DonnafromDC
Reviews.Content: I was going by reviews from two travel books, one of which was Fodor, that said how the place was nice and gave you a feel for an old canal house. The reality was that first, after arranging for two canal view rooms months ago, they tried to to put me in the back overlooking an air shaft. The woman tried to say that I had only made a request for a canal view and they had none. I told her that I had it in writing that I was to have two canal rooms, then an attic room on the canal miraculously opened up. (FYI: the canal view was the only reason I selected the hotel, so it was a big deal.) The two young folks (18 and 25) with us took the attic room and let us have theirs, which was an actual canal side view room as promised (at least there was one). But it was the attic room that had the bed bugs. I never knew of anyone who had them and I have to admit that I have been skeptical when I see it written, thinking that people might be inventing it to trash the hotel. So that there is no doubt in anyones mind, I am posting two photos I took of her face and arm. She got bites on many parts of her body the first night, even though she was under the sheets. We so wanted to think they were mosquitoes, but the bites were redder and became hotter than mosquito bites, and they were in places that mosquitoes just would not have had access too. Further, her brother, usually prone to mosquito bites, sleeping in the next bed, had no bites. Then, after the first night, when she slept on top of the bed instead of inside the sheets and covers and/or in a another bed, she stopped getting bitten. But the bites continued to hurt her for several days. We informed the hotel, but since now I know there was a June review with the same problem, it looks like they do not take the problem seriously. Generally, the place is run very unprofessionally. When we arrived around 5:00, for example, there was a sign that we needed to go the restaurant in back. Generally, there is no one from the hotel there after 5:00. The attic room had a lot of mold and even some body hair in the shower. Our room was just dusty and the shower stall had considerable mildew built up in the tiles. I developed immediately bad sinuses due to the dirt and mold of the room and that stayed with me through the rest of the trip. The hall and breakfast room carpeting look like the worst condition I have ever seen. I saw the same loose pieces of stuff on the hall carpet steps everyday, indicating that they never vacuum them or at least it must be rarely. The SIngel Canal is the loudest canal, I believe, with parties going on late at night. There is no air-conditioning and it is too loud to sleep with the windows open and there are no screens. (This part I expected, but am just trying to be thorough.) The told us breakfast was served until 11:00, but on the last day (of a three night stay), the kids were told at 10:30 that the breakfast was closed. To summarize: it is not clean, not well run, and it has bed bugs. And, it is not even cheap. Do not stay here. I will note that there is one young man who is very helpful and helped us with making calls to deal with a stolen wallet (that did not happen there). But one personable desk attendant is insufficient to make a stay there a good experience. Donna Hanousek Washington, DC

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam-Butterfly
Reviews.Content: Would not go back to the Hotel Agora, the reason's being that the hotel is located next door to a night club, which if your in a front room is very noisey, the rooms were not up to date, no tea & coffee making facilities, seperate beds in a double room, the breakfast IS minimal & consists of a hard boiled egg, toast, fruit and cereal but you need to get down early enough as once its gone its gone! Our TV was tiny and had one english channel. The location of the hotel is perfect and easy to find, only a ten minute walk from all the attractions and the staff in the hotel were really nice and always happy to help. Overall it was a nice hotel but personally i think its WAY to overpriced x

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Jennidee
Reviews.Content: this hotel cost over 500 euro for four nights and WELL wasn't worth it. The staff were very helpfull and the hotel was in a nice area jus ten minute walk from everything but what they didnt tell us is there is a club right next door which is quite loud if your in a front facing room. The rooms were old fashioned with not a lot to offer, no kettle, a tv that had one english channel and 2 beds even though i has stated a double room. Breakfast was minimal, hard boiled eggs to peel yourself, toast, small selection of fruit, cereal and if you come down early enough there was cakes and pastry. Think its way overpriced 300 euro would have been acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel right on the spot”
Reviews.Author: amsterdamfan1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of Amsterdam, it couldn't be any better. It is literally opposite of Spui square with good restaurants and beautiful monumental buildings. The nine streets in the 'Jordaan' are just around the corner and ideal for a afternoon of window shopping. The hotel is secured safely and accessible with room keys. The rooms are practically designed and they have a classic twitch on it. There's a normal continental breakfast where everybody can find something to their liking. When I stayed here, the staff was very helpful and really did their best to make you feel at home in their town.

Reviews.Title: “Caution for repeat customers”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGeorge9
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here approximately 5 years ago and while the rooms were quite basic, the location, friendly staff and quiet rooms overlooking the garden courtyard in the back of the building made us decide to book this location again during your recent visit to Amsterdam. How things have changed--we were told that the owner of the hotel has purchased the nightclub directly behind the building and as a result has removed the garden courtyard from the hotel and converted this to an outdoor service area for the nightclub. During the day all seems as in the past, but around 8 or 9 PM the noise starts and does not end until very late. If you are looking for a good nights sleep this place is no longer for you. We were told that others had similar complaints--we had booked for three nights but left after the first night. As noted in some of the other reviews the rooms have deteriorated since we were last at this hotel and could certainly use some maintenance, such as new carpeting and a paint job.

Reviews.Title: “Needs A Major Overhaul”
Reviews.Author: Expat5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Agora with our three children in March. We were supposed to have adjacent rooms, but due to an "emergency" our rooms were two floors apart. We didn't feel comfortable with that, so my husband and I split up to be with the kids. We expected small rooms and lots of stairs, and that was fine. But as I entered the rooms and saw the stained carpets, chipped paint, and cigarette burns on the blankets I just felt sick. I asked what we could do to get out of the reservation but of course we were stuck with it. Along with thin towels and lukewarm showers, the last night we battled the mosquitoes that came in when the cleaning staff left the windows wide open. Pretty much the only advantage was the location--very central. And there is a mediocre breakfast included in the rate. I can say that the pillows and mattress were good (no mattress pad of course, just a thin sheet), the place is very secure, and the staff was friendly and helpful (though young). For the price you should be able to do much better!

Reviews.Title: “A bargain!”
Reviews.Author: brendyflemy
Reviews.Content: Booked over the internet, paid 80 euros. Great location, staff super-friendly, room pretty good, breakfast fine. Its not the Ritz, but a great deal price-wise and a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: caro084
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam in Agora Hotel last june. It was the second time. We went once before a couple of years before. This time I was very disappointed to see that the general state of the room was very mediocre compared to the rate (more than 140 â‚¬ per night) : dirty walls, carpet with holes, outdates interior decoration. In a word, the room would have deserved a good renovation! However, the location of the hotel is really perfect to visit and enjoy amsterdam day and night life! Just be aware that the rooms on the street are quite noisy because of a night club next door. In the morning the breakfast is correct. And the staff is nice and accommodating. In sum, not too bad but don't expect too much !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: tea42California_USA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nothing to reccomend it other than the location. Let's just say the bath featured a can of bug-spray and mildewed tile. Then there was the dirty carpet, the tired bedding, the youth hostel level of service. This was basically a diappointment all-round. Perhaps some of the rooms are nicer and more updated. Ours was a horror -- the type of room in which you do not want to spend an extra 10 minutes. Terrible value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBoos
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agora is incredibly central, overlooking the Singel canal, which is definitely its biggest selling point. Our room was a bit tired-looking, although the bathroom had clearly been fairly recently replaced. As with any of the canal-side houses, the hotel is quite narrow and as a result the staircase is relatively steep and twisty - not ideal for anyone with mobility issues. The breakfast is included in the price of the room, which makes a nice change. The buffet is limited but good - the usual croissants, ham and cheese: John was a particular fan of the chocolate croissants! For a weekend trip to Amsterdam, the Hotel Agora isn't a bad choice - the staff are welcoming, the rooms are adequate and the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely situated hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Annemunchen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam in the lovely hotel Agora! We really liked the hotel and its surroundings. We were surprised of the location; a lot of the famous museums are walking distance from the hotel and it is even situated on the Singel, one of the canals of Amsterdam. All the members of the staff were very friendly and cooperative. Due to the fact that it was our first time in Amsterdam, we had a lot of questions. Therefor the personell of Hotel Agora has given a lot of good advises for sightseeing in Amsterdam. We also appreciated the dutch breakfast in the morning, good service!

Reviews.Title: “this place is knackered”
Reviews.Author: gillgills
Reviews.Content: This is an uncomfortable hotel that's cold, ugly, shabby and very, very tired. Rooms are small, basic and cold, and breakfast is toast in a bland poky room. On our lasty night here we came home at around 1 am to find our door lock was faulty and we couldn't get into our room so we reported it to the night staff. We spent 4 hours in the lobby waiting while the staff organised a repair man to open the door. We were ignored by the staff as we waited. Eventually after 3 hours I found a member of staff and requested blankets to try and get warmed up in the lobby as we waited. Blankets were located after approx. 30 mins and they smelt disgusting. We finally got in to our room at 5:15 am. Thankfully this happened on our last night in this hotel that I was glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Somepeople291
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have just returned from a three day break in Amsterdam where we stayed at the Agora. Having read the reviews on this site I have to say we were all a little apprehensive about what we would find. Yes there was graffiti on the walls outside and yes there was a strange smell at the bottom of the front staircase, but on the whole we thought it was a nice hotel. We arrived too early to check in but the lady on reception (who was very friendly and spoke excellent English) allowed us leave our cases while we went off to explore. We returned later in the day to check in and were each shown to our rooms by the receptionist. OK, the rooms are a little tired (I donâ€™t think the tops of the curtains have ever been dusted) but the room was a nice size, the bed was comfy and the bed linen clean. There was a safe in the cupboard which was easy to use and the TV had more than enough channels. The ensuite shower room was very nice, it looks like its been recently refurbished. There was shampoo and soap provided. The shower was nice and very powerful (usually a rarity in a hotel shower!). Our rooms were cleaned and made up everyday with clean towels. The breakfast was more than sufficient and very nice with a selection of cereals, pastries, breads, meat and cheese. Fresh orange juice, tea and coffee were also served.The only downside to the hotel was on the Friday night you could clearly here the disco/nightclub next door. The music was still going at 1am, but it didnâ€™t keep me awake so I have no idea when it finally quietened down. All in all, for a two star hotel this was excellent value for money and a very nice friendly place to stay. Would I stay here againâ€¦.? Yes, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Small and charcterful”
Reviews.Author: Martin_from_Duffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 1997, at that time rated hotel high. Stayed again in July 2006. On this visit some disappointment about slightly rundown now and not being kept in best condition, as evidenced in other comments here, but on balance still liked it and still several positive points. Location of hotel good. Better hotels tend to be further out, while the ones right in the centre are generally inferior budget ones. Stayed in room 35. Small attic room on top floor, rather cramped, and many quite steep stairs to reach it; but adequately warned about these points on website and when booking. Double bed, window with no view, very little storage space, but definitely a room with appealing character. Walls need some paint. Own private bathroom across corridor, ie not ensuite; obviously recently refurbished, good size, high standard, very clean, plenty of hot water, shower quite good. Electronic safe in room, no extra charge, good. Key cards to control access to both hotel and room. Mosquitoes and a noisy unit outside (a/c or similar) a problem the first night (unusually hot weather), so kept window closed subsequent nights. Staff efficient, helpful and friendly. Breakfast typical Dutch continental of various breads, jam, cheese, cold meat, eggs, and a few other supplies. Good coffee and orange juice. Served as help yourself buffet, not a vast spread, but quite good and sufficient for us. Breakfast room peaceful and quite spacious, better than many hotels. A few items not fresh on second morning, assume left over from previous day, otherwise a good and relaxing breakfast. Some parts of hotel need attention. Graffiti on outside an unwelcome start. Stair carpet in poor condition, and distinct musty smell on lower stairs, as noticed by everyone else on this website. Repainting some walls would be a significant, and cheap, enhancement. Paid 92 Euros per night, which is reasonable for Amsterdam (although 88 Euros posted in room ?). Larger ensuite rooms around 120 Euros, 140 euros for view of canal. Booking dealt with efficiently by email, cancellation available up to 48 hours before arrival. In summary: Needs some refurbishment - new carpets and some paint, and ensure everything at breakfast is fresh. Otherwise, still an attractive hotel with character, good value, good location, a typical Amsterdam house rather than a bland hotel. (Other than spending a lot more money elsewhere) we would probably stay here again. Martin & Sally

Reviews.Title: “Good Location that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that has seen better times. The location is great, close to everything and right on the Singel canal. However, the lobby is a good clue that the Agora is getting tired to say the least. The furnishings are old and the walls need a paint job. When you are ready to go up the stairs from the lobby, a strange smell greets your nostrals. Not pleasant. The rooms are ok, the showers could use a good cleaning, but our room had a nice view of the canal. There is a disco next store and on a Friday and Saturday night the pounding of the music beat goes until 4am. Unless you sleep though anything, this will be a problem. The staff is friendly, but the breakfest is skimpy. It seemed like I needed to ask for basic food stuff every morning, like juice and coffee. It's too bad that I can't give this hotel a good review, if the owners of this hotel tried, this could be a very nice and cozy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, somewhat odd hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarmonyinWV
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully friendly staff and great location makes up for somewhat decayed state of furnishings and especially carpet. We settled on "funky" as the best description of it - very steep stairs with weird angles, quite decent sized rooms with better than average bathrooms, reasonable breakfasts, but on the verge of run-down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blakemont
Reviews.Content: Too bad the hotel does not live up to the website. It was dirty everywhere, from soilded carpets to worn walls and doors to large amounts of mold in the shower. The staff was friendly but inexperienced and could not give basic tour information or get a taxi for us. The complimentary breakfast was pathetic and you are better to pay for something at a cafe nearby. The bed was hard and difficult to sleep on. The location was ideal near the Leidesplein and a tram stop. This was the cheapest canal house with a water view I was able to find. But at $135 Euro a night I expected a basic level that was not there.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macdaddy18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worth the money. Stayed there three terrible nights. The beds were horrible - might as well been trying to sleep in a hammock. The room stank of smoke, and most of our neighbors stayed in their rooms smoking pot all day, which is their right, but the smoke filled the halls and all the rooms on the floor. There are no non smoking rooms. On a scary note, the fire escape stairs aren't finished, and they're made of wood. That seems like a bad idea. The location is good, but for 120 Euro, you can find better places. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Agora- Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Agora on my eighth visit to A'dam. Have stayed in many hotels there and do not consider myself to be a nit- picky person. However, I have to agree with the sentiments of those who previously posted- sewage smell in the stairway, mold in the bathroom, etc. Breakfast was skimpy- on my first day there they "ran out" of boiled eggs. The staff was pleasant enough, but for the money you could do better elsewhere. The best thing about it was the location- everything very walkable from this hotel. Still, my advice is that you could do much better elsewhere for the same price or less. Keep looking before you settle for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The location could not have been more perfect. Close to all the attractions. The rooms were decent, nothing special but clean and welcoming. We had a canel view which was very charming. Security was very good with three locked doors (front door, stairway and room) using a key card to access each, along with a safe. A couple of small problems. First, the stairs are very steap so keep that in mind. It wasn't a problem for me but it might be for some. Second, there is no 24 hour receptionist so we had them book a cab for 6:30 am the night before since there would not be anyone there that early. Well, the cab never showed up. Not sure whose fault that was but luckily there are many cabs that pass by across the canal and we were able to get one that way. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as long as the stairs are not going to be a problem and you won't expect anything special. The breakfast was decend too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, despite the location”
Reviews.Author: Lorks
Reviews.Content: This is in many ways a terrible hotel. Prepare to be disappointed - I know I was. Imagaine going back to the 60s - and you'll find the rooms haven't been touched since. The worst is the carpets - absolutely filthy. Old furniture, beds that sag - and worst of all, mould in the bathrooms. Sure, the place is in the centre of everything, and the 4 rooms at the front with windows over the Singel canal have a great view - but don't turn round and look at the dump you are staying in. The rooms are tiny. I gave up after one night, after finding there was no hot water, and my TV had no reception. No, none at all, of any picture! This place isn't particularly cheap either, and there are much better hotels just over the road. My view - avoid.

Reviews.Title: “splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, a family group of six aged 12 to 56, stayed at the Agora for 4 nights - and enjoyed our stay very much. Perfect location close to many interisting places, locations and restaurants. Nice and quiet rooms, good beds, recently renovated bathrooms. Delicious breakfast buffet in cozy room. The hotel is clean, safe and quiet. The staff are kind and helpful. Good quality for money - we will definitely stay at the Agora next time in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the attic room . It was great skylights fridge living room bed room and the bathroom, whole ceiling was a skylight. Be prepared tho if you stay in the room to walk up lots of stairs. The breakfast was great. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Taste”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at the Agora Hotel during May this year (2005). Apart from the fact that the hotel is centrally situated within walking distance to all major attractions and a relative, good enough breakfast, there is nothing positive that we can say about the hotel. Firstly when you are in the foyer of the hotel a sewerage smell hangs in the air, secondly the furbishment of the room dated from the 1960's, the carpet was disgustingly filfy and the room had a terrible smell of cigarette smoke. (We are smokers ourselves). The bedding, specially the mattresses are disgusting and it is obvious that the owners do not plough any capital back into upgrading the facilities. The Agora Hotel will be a definite NO for us to visit again. We have travelled a lot, we are not fussy people but the Agora Hotel was a terrible mistake for us to have stayed in during our visit to lovely Amsterdam Alba Moolman, Cape Town, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Agora”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (3 females) stayed at the Hotel Agora, Amsterdam from May 8-14, 2005, and loved the hotel. It is in a GREAT location - 15 min. walk north to Dam Square (up a great shopping street) and 15 min. walk south to the museums (down a great shopping street). The room was quite adequate for the price, with a brand new bathroom. It was very clean, safe and quiet. The breakfast buffet (which was included in the price) was very good -- cereals, breads, boiled eggs, cheese, cold cuts, tea, coffee & orange juice. The staff were very friendly and helpful as well. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel for the great price, location and hospitality. Transportation tip - buy a round trip Connexion bus shuttel ticket at the airport which takes you from the airport to the hotel and back (about 18 euros return). The bus conveniently stops 2 blocks from the hotel - but make sure you tell the driver it's Hotel "Ahora" (Dutch pronunciation of Agora) and even show the driver the name and address of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly.good location”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamBoycee
Reviews.Content: Just back from Hotel Agora - good value, well located hotel on the Singel Canal next to the floating flower market. Friendly, informative staff. Rooms at the front look over canal - double glazing and dark curtains so you get a good night's sleep. Rooms at back look over a pretty courtyard garden.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a semi central location”
Reviews.Author: LouieGroup
Reviews.Content: This Hotel attracted me thru its reviews and price. The location was a few doors down from the main road thru town, but quiet. Transportation was easy, A variety of restaurants were nearby for dinner, and the hotel serves a nice breakfast in a nice setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, olde worlde charm”
Reviews.Author: Justraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agora Hotel in Amsterdam from the 6th to 9th January 05. It is on the Singel Canal, within minutes of the Flower Market. My husband and I and our 13 year old had Room 32, a Triple facing the Canal. The outlook is lovely, specially at night, with the canal and street lit up. Being winter, we had the windows opened only a few inches for fresh air, so the noise of the nearby Trams did not bother us, but it could be different in summer. I think the ambience more than makes up for any background noise. The room had a double bed (two singles pushed together) and a single. The bathroom is a bit small for three, but recently renovated and everything is clean. Towels were changed everyday. There is a shower only. The room smelt strongly of smoke when we came in, but this is a problem I think one encounters everywhere in this city. We got some air freshener from the Management and left the windows open for a while and that helped. Breakfast, which was included, was good. Cereal, juice, beautiful breads, toast and spreads, hard boiled eggs, some typical Dutch sweet cookies/toast, tea/coffee. The breakfast room was obviously the living room of the previous owners and is furnished with some lovely Dutch pieces, very comfortable and relaxing. The Managers/Owners, Els and Yvo, and their staff, all speak English, are friendly and extremely helpful with suggestions and directions. They called a Taxi to take us to Central Station on our departure and it arrived in a matter of minutes. The only drawback of the Agora is the steep, narrow stairs to the upper levels. We had to drag three big suitcases to our room and it was not easy. All Canal house hotels must have this problem, but be forewarned if you cannot manage steps. There are many good restaurants within a short walk of the Hotel. we tried an Indonesian restaurant, that does "Rijstaffel", it was excellent. All the sights are reached by a short tram ride or a brisk walk. The biggest problem we encountered in Amsterdam was the amount of smokers in restaurants. There are few designated "non smoking" areas and some of these are in very close proximity to the smoking section. Ask, before you sit down, if this is as much of a bother to you, as it was to us. Amsterdam can be very cloudy and windy. A good head scarf is invaluable, besides all the other cold weather gear. We truly enjoyed our short stay in Amsterdam and the Agora did much towards that satisfied feeling. From what I have seen on the Web, it is one of the most reasonably priced Canal hotels. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviewer from England that the person from the US is off the mark with comments about security. We stayed at the Agora during October 2004 and never felt the least bit unsafe. There is plenty of security, and we enjoyed our stay there. We had a canal-side room, and are thinking of getting a garden-side room when we go back, because there is quite a bit of street noise on the canal side. But at night we just plugged in the fan that was in the room and it drowned out most of the streetcar noise. And it was nice to look out the window and see the passers-by. At any rate, we found the Agora very comfortable, the staff was very nice, and the location is just great. We also liked the breakfast. There's plenty of choice with coffee, tea, toast, cereals, soft-boiled eggs, meats and cheeses. We'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of November 2004.Centrally situated, quiet at night, trams stop right near it. This hotel was excellent. The only slight complaint was that we are ex-smokers, and the room had obviously had a cigar smoker in it before us. Having said that, the room overlooking the canal on the first floor was warm, comfortable, quiet and had a great view. The stairs take a bit of negotiating, but are soon got used to. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Would highly recommend, and hope to return next year. Amsterdan and the canals are wonderful! It was so easy to get a train from Schipol, the station is below the airport. We had planned to get a taxi, but everything is so simple, we caught the train to Central Amsterdam, then got a tram outside the railway station (No. 1.2 or 5) to Konigsplien, to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kilmistr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel November 25-28, 2004. My room was #35. The room was a bit small and the covers a bit threadbare. The room was slightly drafty, but o.k. (how much time are you going to spend in your hotel room?). The bathroom across the hall was EXCELLENT. Looks like it was just refinished. The room and bathroom were always clean. Breakfast was o.k. The staff were very nice and helped with any questions I had. There are many bars and restaurants in the area. Tram stop for trams 1, 2, and 5 are just around the corner. The hotel is very easy to get to from Central Station, and you can get to the the museum area, or any other destination very easily as well. The location of the hotel was very good. I felt safe at this hotel. FYI there is no elevator, so if you do not like stairs, you want want to find another hotel. This was my 3rd time to the city and I had a pleasant time. I would stay here again. kilmistr@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable & well situated”
Reviews.Author: kalimera
Reviews.Content: We chose the Agora having read other reviews on this site and were happily not disappointed. We stayed for a 3-night stay, and, having arrived early were able to check into our room at 1030 am. Check in was friendly, speedy and efficient and secure, the room we had booked was a double with ensuite facilities we did not pay extra for canal view and as it was had a view of nearby offices, allowing plenty of people watching , the huge windows were screened by full length voile and long lined curtains. the room was of average size with a huge comfortable double bed, wardrobe with safe deposit box - at no additional cost - and bureau and chairs. The bathroom was modern and clean with a massive walk in shower dispensing hot water every time we used it. There was a hairdryer & shaver point and large soft white towels which were changed daily. We were situated on the 2nd floor and the stairs were quite steep but we soon became acclimitised to them. We found the hotel to be quiet at night times even allowing for its central location . The room was warmly heated and we were able to open the windows to allow additional ventilation. Buffet breakfast was available from 730-10 and there was a wide varied selection to choose from. The Singel is a very pretty canal and the location of the Agora is very handy for Spui , and the Flowermarket about 5mins. away ; the Leidesplein, Vondel Park and Dam square are about 10 mns. away and Red Light area and Station about 15-20 mins walk. There are lots of bars , cafes and a wide choice of varying eteries all close by. Just watch out on the walkways for the bikes !

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Agora, Very unsafe, beware”
Reviews.Author: LaurieMillvalley
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Hotel Agora are uncomfortable, there are no screens on the windows, no air conditioning and mosquitos are rampant at night. We were bitten from head to toe. If that wasn't enough, the doors on the rooms are made out of particle board, the locks are flimsy, front desk security is non-existent, and we were robbed! The Hotel did nothing to help us. Don't stay here; its' unsafe!

Reviews.Title: “Altogether OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: July 2004: We arrived very early on our first day in Amsterdam from an all night transit from London. We were tired and the owner offered us some breakfast-even though we were not entitled to it on that morning. We thought that was nice, however, the owner and her assistant proceeded to talk about us in Dutch as we were only a few feet away eating (about how we were poor backpackers and had booked the cheapest room, what was she to do but give us breakfast etc-She offered the breakfast!) Not realising my husband is Dutch and he could understand everything, it was an embarrasing situation. We went to see the city and came back when our room was ready, the owner asked us where we were from etc and my husband spoke to her in Dutch, her face went red and that said it all. As for the room and location, that was all great, but our first experience tainted our stay and made us wonder if this happens with other guests who can't understand what's being said. We thought it was very unprofessional, rude and altogether uncalled for. Next time, we will stay somewhere else that will hopefully appreciate our choosing to stay at their establishment, not put us down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Agora with my partner and found it very pleasant. The location, as other reviewers have said, is excellent with most attractions in walking distance, if not a tram stop is a stones throw away. The staff were friendly and helpful and we were made to feel welcome. Our room was of adequate size, nothing fancy, clean with a nice bathroom. A variety of food is provided for the self-service breakfast, including cereal, breads, cheese and ham. I personally found the same selection for breakfast a bit tedious after a few days but I'm sure it is adequate for most. All in all this is a very nice Hotel, I cannot think of anything bad about it!
